Key Match Events: Mayank Yadav bowled with a rattling pace in a promising debut while mystery spinner Varun Chakaravarthy made an impressive comeback to set up India’s dominating seven-wicket win over Bangladesh.
Arshdeep Singh was the PLAYER OF THE MATCH for his brilliant bowling spell.
Hardik Pandya and Washington Sundar also chipped in with one each as well.
Debutant Mayank Yadav also performed well and got one wicket.
Varun Chakaravarthy got three wickets each.
Bangladesh's Najmul Hossain Shanto and Mehidy Hasan crossed the 20-run mark.
Sanju Samson failed to convert his start again but showed his class in his knock of 29 off 19.
Hardik Pandya stayed unbeaten on 39 off just 16 balls.
Nitish Kumar Reddy joined hands with Hardik Pandya and made sure to finish the job.
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav, the victorious skipper of India, says they just tried to back their skills and tried to walk the talk.
On being asked about the two debutants, Mayank and Nitish, he appreciates them and says they are interesting players and is looking forward to watching them do well in future games.

Najmul Hossain Shanto, the captain of Bangladesh, says that they did not start well. Adds that in T20s it is important to play well in the Powerplay but they didn’t. Mentions that the plan was to bat positively but they also need to adjust according to the situation.
Najmul Hossain Shanto also mentions that they need to focus on strike rotation and not only on hitting boundaries. Says that they scored 95-odd runs in 14 overs but lost too many wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Mayank Yadav had a good debut.
Varun Chakaravarthy is up for a quick chat. He says it feels like a rebirth for him to be back in the blues.
Arshdeep Singh and Varun Chakaravarthy were the pick of the bowlers with three wickets each.
Bangladesh's Rishad Hossain did not get a wicket but bowled really well and Shoriful Islam was also economical in his two overs.
The target for India was not a big one, but the way they executed the chase was excellent.
The positive intent was visible right from the start when the two openers took on the attack.
Abhishek Sharma fell to an unfortunate run out but not before playing a fiery cameo.
Others: Bangladesh posted a below-par total with only Najmul Hossain Shanto and Mehidy Hasan crossing the 20-run mark.
India's target was 127, which they chased down in 11.5 overs.
The first T20I in this new stadium in Gwalior and the Men in Blue were simply brilliant with both bat and bowl providing an incredible experience for the packed crowd.
India takes the early lead in the series with Bangladesh having their task cut out now.
